title: Lipin Bor
text:
Lipin Bor () is a <a href="types%20of%20inhabited%20localities%20in%20Russia">rural locality</a> (a "<a href="village%23Russia">selo</a>") and the <a href="administrative%20center">administrative center</a> of <a href="Vashkinsky%20District">Vashkinsky District</a>, <a href="Vologda%20Oblast">Vologda Oblast</a>, <a href="Russia">Russia</a>, located on the northern shore of <a href="Lake%20Beloye%20%28Vologda%20Oblast%29">Lake Beloye</a>. It also serves as the administrative center of <a href="Lipinoborsky%20Selsoviet">Lipinoborsky Selsoviet</a>, one of the twelve selsoviets into which the district is <a href="subdivisions%20of%20Russia%23Administrative%20divisions">administratively divided</a>. <a href="Subdivisions%20of%20Russia%23Municipal%20divisions">Municipally</a>, it is the administrative center of Lipinoborskoye Rural Settlement. Population: 
History.
Lipin Bor was founded in 1938. The administrative center of Vashkinsky District was immediately transferred to Lipin Bor from the "selo" of <a href="Vashki%2C%20Vologda%20Oblast">Vashki</a>.
Economy.
Industry.
In Lipin Bor, there are food industry and timber industry enterprises.
Transportation.
There is a highway connecting <a href="Vologda">Vologda</a> and <a href="Vytegra">Vytegra</a> which passes several kilometers from Lipin Bor. Another road branches off south, running via Lipin Bor to <a href="Belozersk">Belozersk</a>. There are also local roads with bus traffic.
Lake Beloye is a part of the <a href="Volga%E2%80%93Baltic%20Waterway">Volga–Baltic Waterway</a> (formerly known as the Mariinsk Canal System), connecting the <a href="Rybinsk%20Reservoir">Rybinsk Reservoir</a> in the river basin of the <a href="Volga%20River">Volga</a> and <a href="Lake%20Onega">Lake Onega</a> in the river basin of the <a href="Neva%20River">Neva</a>.
Culture and recreation.
The Trinity Church (1792) in Lipin Bor has been designated as an architectural monument of local significance.
Vashkinsky District Museum is located in Lipin Bor.
The height of a telecommunications mast in Lipin Bor is , which makes it one of the tallest in Russia.
